posts.name: Greg Middleton
posts.cooked:
We are essentially a rookie team, with no returning programmers. We have a Win 10 comp running 2024 WPILib VS Code.  We have kitbot code from FRC download that we have opened, changed from PWM to CAN . And are attempting to Build Code on Build.Gradle.  We get the below error??

we did already try deleting the .gradle cache from C:\Users\0353-Robotics\ but that did not resolve the issue.

Suggestions?

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Can you run ./gradlew build --stacktrace from the command prompt and post that? That will tell us what file is failing to load. Likely one of the vendor dep filesl.

posts.name: Greg Middleton

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: It looks like you might have a corrupt or invalid json file in your vendordeps/ folder?  What are all the files you have in there, and do they all look like normal text files?

posts.name: Greg Middleton
posts.cooked:
image 1232×260 11.3 KB

image 1232×260 11.3 KB

image 1232×260 11.3 KB

Both files open in VS Code when double clicking and on cursory glance appear to be valid JSON formats.

One additional note, I believe this project was moved over from a Mac OS machine where it did build. Is there a path or other setting in here somewhere that is confused with moving from a unix machine to a windows machine?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Can you zip up your whole project directory and post it to Google drive or somewhere?  I wonder if there’s a Unicode BOM order marker or something like that embedded in those vendor deps.

posts.name: Greg Middleton
posts.cooked: This link work? 6824 KitBot Java Code.zip - Google Drive

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
The zip file contains a couple of resource forks in it (from Mac) in the vendordeps folder.  They may be hidden files in normal Windows explorer view but Gradle is picking them up.  I bet this is the issue.  Try renaming the vendordeps folder to a different name, creating a new vendordeps folder, and copying just the REVLib.json and WPILibNewCommands.json files to the new vendordeps folder.  To be super safe you could copy just those file contents to new files in the new folder.

You may run into similar issues with the java files in the src/main/java/frc/robot folders as well, but potentially Gradle uses a different approach to glob those.

posts.name: Greg Middleton
posts.cooked: Good Catch! After deleting the two hidden files, it now builds successfully.

posts.name: system

data.fancy_title: WSLIB Kitbot Code Build Failure - Failed to apply plugin class edu.wpi.first.GradleRio
data.title: WSLIB Kitbot Code Build Failure - Failed to apply plugin class edu.wpi.first.GradleRio

accepted_answer.excerpt: The zip file contains a couple of resource forks in it (from Mac) in the vendordeps folder.  They may be hidden files in normal Windows explorer view but Gradle is picking them up.  I bet this is the issue.  Try renaming the vendordeps folder to a different name, creating a new vendordeps folder, an…
